#summary Attributes and modifiers for models.
#labels Featured

NOTE: All objects will automatically have ':id, :created, :updated' attributes.

===has_attributes===

Add basic attributes types with this. 

eg: 
{{{
class MyModel
  has_attributes :name, :age, :height, :birthday
end
}}}

===are_ints and are_dates===

Lets simple_record know that certain attributes defined in has_attributes should be treated as integers (this is required because SimpleDB only has strings).

eg:
{{{
class MyModel
  has_attributes :name, :age, :height, :birthday
  are_ints :age, :height
  are_dates :birthday
end
}}}

===belongs_to===

Creates a many-to-one relationship. Can only have one per belongs_to call.

{{{
class MyModel
  belongs_to :school
  has_attributes :name, :age, :height, :birthday
  are_ints :age, :height
  are_dates :birthday
end
}}}

Which requires another class called 'School' or you can specify the class explicitly with:

{{{
belongs_to :school, :class_name => "Institution"
}}}

===set_table_name or set_domain_name===

{{{
class SomeModel
  set_table_name :different_model
end
}}}
